The Gallagher Brothers

Liam Gallagher

Personal Information

  • Born: September 21, 1972
  • Role: Lead Vocalist
  • Years Active: 1991-2009 (with Oasis)

Biography

Liam Gallagher, the younger of the Gallagher brothers, became the definitive frontman of the 1990s as Oasis's lead singer. Known for his distinctive singing voice and controversial personality, Liam's stage presence and attitude helped define the band's image. His unique singing style, combining John Lennon-esque vocals with a punk rock delivery, became one of Oasis's most recognizable features.

Notable Achievements

  • Voted Greatest Frontman of All Time by Q Magazine readers
  • Wrote several Oasis songs including "Songbird" and "I'm Outta Time"
  • Successful solo career post-Oasis

Noel Gallagher

Personal Information

  • Born: May 29, 1967
  • Role: Lead Guitarist, Primary Songwriter
  • Years Active: 1991-2009 (with Oasis)

Biography

Noel Gallagher, the chief songwriter and lead guitarist of Oasis, is widely regarded as one of the most influential British songwriters of his generation. Joining his brother's band as a roadie, he quickly became the driving creative force behind Oasis, writing most of their hits including "Wonderwall," "Don't Look Back in Anger," and "Champagne Supernova."

Songwriting Legacy

  • Wrote 8 UK Number One singles
  • Received the Ivor Novello Award for Outstanding Song Collection
  • Over 100 million records sold worldwide

The Brothers' Relationship

The relationship between Liam and Noel Gallagher has been one of rock music's most famous sibling rivalries. Their volatile relationship often made headlines, with numerous public spats and on-stage incidents throughout Oasis's career. Despite their differences, their creative tension helped produce some of the most iconic British music of the 1990s.

Notable Incidents

  • 1994: First major public fight during recording session in Los Angeles
  • 1995: The infamous Cricket Bat incident during recording of (What's the Story) Morning Glory?
  • 2000: Barcelona incident leading to Noel temporarily leaving the tour
  • 2009: Paris altercation leading to Oasis's split
